content:
TaskItem Class

In this Article

Defines a single item of the project as it is passed into a task.

Syntax

Declaration

public sealed class TaskItem : MarshalByRefObject, Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem2

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • System.MarshalByRefObject
  • TaskItem

Inherited Members

CreateObjRef(Type)
,
GetLifetimeService()
,
MemberwiseClone(Boolean)
,
Equals(Object)
,
Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetHashCode()
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)

Remarks

TaskItem objects do not exactly correspond to item elements in project files. If they did, then tasks would have access to data that was not explicitly passed into the task through the project file. This is not a security issue, but rather an issue with project file clarity and transparency.

This class has to be sealed since the build engine instantiates its own copy of this type. If a third party were to extend this class, then the build engine will yield an undesired behavior.

Constructors summary

TaskItem()

Initializes a new instance of the TaskItem class.
TaskItem(ITaskItem)

Initializes a new instance of the TaskItem class using the specified source ITaskItem.
TaskItem(String)

Initializes a new instance of the TaskItem class using the specified item-specification string.
TaskItem(String,IDictionary)

Initializes a new instance of the TaskItem class using the specified item-specification string and its metadata.

Properties summary

ItemSpec

Gets or sets the item specification.
MetadataCount

Gets the number of metadata set on the item.
MetadataNames

Gets the names of all the metadata on the item.

Methods summary

CloneCustomMetadata()

Clones the collection of custom metadata for the item specification.
CopyMetadataTo(ITaskItem)

Copies the item-specification metadata to the specified destination task item.
GetMetadata(String)

Retrieves the specified metadata on the item.
InitializeLifetimeService()

When overridden in a derived class, gives task items infinite lease time.
RemoveMetadata(String)

Removes the specified metadata on the item.
SetMetadata(String,String)

Sets or modifies the value of the specified metadata on the item.
ToString()

Gets the item specification.

Operators summary

op_Explicit(TaskItem)

Explicit Interface Implementations summary

ITaskItem2.CloneCustomMetadataEscaped()

ITaskItem2 implementation which returns a clone of the metadata on this object. Values returned are in their original escaped form.
ITaskItem2.EvaluatedIncludeEscaped

ITaskItem2 implementation which gets or sets the item include value. For disk-based items this would be the file path.
ITaskItem2.GetMetadataValueEscaped(String)

ITaskItem2 implementation which allows the values of metadata on the item to be queried.
ITaskItem2.SetMetadataValueLiteral(String,String)

ITaskItem2 implementation which allows a piece of custom metadata to be set on the item. Assumes that the value passed in is unescaped, and escapes the value as necessary in order to maintain its value.

Constructors

  • TaskItem()

    Initializes a new instance of the TaskItem class.

    public TaskItem ();

    Remarks

    This constructor enables this type to be COM-creatable.

  • TaskItem(ITaskItem)

    Initializes a new instance of the TaskItem class using the specified source ITaskItem.

    public TaskItem (Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem sourceItem);

    Parameters

    • sourceItem
      ITaskItem

      The item to copy.

  • TaskItem(String)

    Initializes a new instance of the TaskItem class using the specified item-specification string.

    public TaskItem (string itemSpec);

    Parameters

    • itemSpec
      String

      The item specification.

  • TaskItem(String,IDictionary)

    Initializes a new instance of the TaskItem class using the specified item-specification string and its metadata.

    public TaskItem (string itemSpec, System.Collections.IDictionary itemMetadata);

    Parameters

    • itemSpec
      String

      The item specification.

    • itemMetadata
      IDictionary

      The custom metadata for the item specification.

Properties

  • ItemSpec

    Gets or sets the item specification.

    public string ItemSpec { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      A String that represents the item specification.

    Remarks

    The ItemSpec for the following item declaration in a project file is File.cs. 

    <ItemGroup>  
    <Compile Include="File.cs"/>  
</ItemGroup>
  • MetadataCount

    Gets the number of metadata set on the item.

    public int MetadataCount { get; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      An Int32 that represents the count of metadata set on the item.

  • MetadataNames

    Gets the names of all the metadata on the item.

    public System.Collections.ICollection MetadataNames { get; }

    Property Value

    • ICollection

      An ICollection of metadata names.

Methods

  • CloneCustomMetadata()

    Clones the collection of custom metadata for the item specification.

    public System.Collections.IDictionary CloneCustomMetadata ();

    Returns

    • IDictionary

      An IDictionary that represents a clone of the custom metadata.

    Remarks

    This method does not include built-in metadata.

  • CopyMetadataTo(ITaskItem)

    Copies the item-specification metadata to the specified destination task item.

    public void CopyMetadataTo (Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem destinationItem);

    Parameters

    • destinationItem
      ITaskItem

      The item that this method will copy metadata to.

    Remarks

    If the metadata already exists on the destination item, then it is not overwritten. The original metadata value supersedes the copied metadata value.

    This method does not copy the item specification to the destination task item.

  • GetMetadata(String)

    Retrieves the specified metadata on the item.

    public string GetMetadata (string metadataName);

    Parameters

    • metadataName
      String

      The name of the metadata to retrieve.

    Returns

    • String

      A String that represents the metadata value.

  • InitializeLifetimeService()

    When overridden in a derived class, gives task items infinite lease time.

    public override object InitializeLifetimeService ();

    Returns

    • Object

      null to specify an infinite lifetime.

    Remarks

    Otherwise, a limited lease of 5 minutes will result; and task instances can expire if they take a long time to process.

  • RemoveMetadata(String)

    Removes the specified metadata on the item.

    public void RemoveMetadata (string metadataName);

    Parameters

    • metadataName
      String

      The name of metadata to remove.

  • SetMetadata(String,String)

    Sets or modifies the value of the specified metadata on the item.

    public void SetMetadata (string metadataName, string metadataValue);

    Parameters

    • metadataName
      String

      The name of metadata to set or modify.

    • metadataValue
      String

      The new value of metadata.

  • ToString()

    Gets the item specification.

    public override string ToString ();

    Returns

    • String

      A String that represents the item specification.

Operators

  • op_Explicit(TaskItem)
    public static string op_Explicit (Microsoft.Build.Utilities.TaskItem taskItemToCast);

    Parameters

    • taskItemToCast
      TaskItem

      To be added.

    Returns

    • String

      To be added.

Explicit Interface Implementations

  • ITaskItem2.CloneCustomMetadataEscaped()

    ITaskItem2 implementation which returns a clone of the metadata on this object. Values returned are in their original escaped form.

    System.Collections.IDictionary ITaskItem2.CloneCustomMetadataEscaped ();

    Returns

    • IDictionary

      Returns the cloned metadata, with values' escaping preserved.

  • ITaskItem2.EvaluatedIncludeEscaped

    ITaskItem2 implementation which gets or sets the item include value. For disk-based items this would be the file path.

    string Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem2.EvaluatedIncludeEscaped { get; set; }

    Returns

    • String

      Returns the item include value.

  • ITaskItem2.GetMetadataValueEscaped(String)

    ITaskItem2 implementation which allows the values of metadata on the item to be queried.

    string ITaskItem2.GetMetadataValueEscaped (string metadataName);

    Parameters

    • metadataName
      String

      The metadata to be queried

    Returns

    • String

      Returns the escaped metadata value.

  • ITaskItem2.SetMetadataValueLiteral(String,String)

    ITaskItem2 implementation which allows a piece of custom metadata to be set on the item. Assumes that the value passed in is unescaped, and escapes the value as necessary in order to maintain its value.

    void ITaskItem2.SetMetadataValueLiteral (string metadataName, string metadataValue);

    Parameters

    • metadataName
      String

      The metadata name.

    • metadataValue
      String

      The metadata value.
